ygData.subject: Revelations
ygData.msgSnippet: *Tavatron lingered in a state of limbo. Her mind felt weak; tired. As if she no longer were a part of it, as if it had somehow become an entity in its own

From: "FIRE FOX" <firefox_y2k@...>

*Tavatron lingered in a state of limbo. Her mind felt weak; tired. As if she 
no longer were a part of it, as if it had somehow become an entity in its 
own right. She momentarily played with the thought of attempting the 
unthinkable, for a warrior anyway. The escape from her torment was not a new 
idea, merely a part of her past she wished to bury deeper than the lies that 
had led her to commit it. Well, attempt and fail may be more precise. She 
had slaughtered dozens, and yet she couldn't even kill herself. How pathetic 
was that? Perhaps fate had a more twisted design. Something neither she nor 
Tav could ever have conceived. Maybe she was just bad with a gun.*

<Pathetic>

'What do you want?'

<Nothing. *chuckle* You were one of the finest Predacon assassins, and you 
panicked when you pulled the trigger>

*Tavatron cringed at the thought. Her twisted counterpart was right. She had 
always been right. Even now she could feel herself slipping from reality. 
The sounds of gunfire and falling bodies were distant echoes around her 
kneeling form. To the world she appeared to be in stasis, to her the pains 
of reality were all too real.*

<You're thinking about it again>

'What makes you say that?'

<I've spent cycle upon tedious cycle in this inferno you call a mind. I've 
done my homework>

'Then shut-up and leave me alone. It is none of your concern.'

<You know, if you die you'll hurt him in more ways then you can imagine>

'Since when do you care about those in my life?'

<Since you decided to end it>

'You want to be free of this torment as much as I.'

<Yes, I suppose so, but not like this. This will benefit no one, not even 
me>

'Then I'll be doing the world a favor.'

*The ground shook with the explosions of an impending battle. Tavatron 
clutched the soft earth, Dinobot's voice echoed faintly. She could barely 
hear it, even though he stood just to the side. She wanted to stand, to yell 
at him, to anger him. If she could get him mad enough he would kill her 
himself. It was in his nature. He was a true warrior. A fighter. Tavatron 
chuckled dryly. He wouldn't kill her. He cared too damn much. It figured. 
Then again, it was because of 'bots like him that she was still here.*

<You should probably get up>

'Why?'

<Cause I don't feel like getting our skid plates kicked right now>

*Tavatron tried to stand, but the pain that shot through her shoulder from 
even the slightest movement was unbearable. She hated this. She hated being 
so weak, so helpless. She had never enjoyed depending on others to lift her 
up when the chips were down. Another dry chuckle. It was like that song from 
earth, what was it called again? She could never remember. There had been so 
many of them. Her favorite had to be the one about the bricks. Or was it 
students?

<Just Another Brick in the Wall>

'That's the one.'

<Wasn't there another one? From what your databanks suggest this isn't your 
absolute fav>

'Shut up.'

*So she had a couple favorites, big deal. Tavatron tensed as Dinobot shifted 
his position in order to get a better grip on her mech-covered waist. His 
voice was getting louder. She could faintly make out a tone of anger laced 
with something else. Care? He was slipping. Normally he would never allow 
such a minor thing to betray his stoic demeanor.*

<You gonna answer him?>

'Yes, I believe I will.'

<He likes you ya know>

'Hmmph.'

*Tavatron groaned softly. The world swam back into focus before her optics. 
The smoking craters and crackle of energy were a welcome sight. It let her 
know she was still alive. And had not lost her nerve. She had been young, 
too young, the first time Tav had made herself known. The shock that she 
would never be alone again, with her thoughts and especially actions had 
terrified her.

She wasn't young anymore. And she wasn't about to give up. To lie quietly in 
some corner of oblivion and wait for judgment to be passed. She was a 
warrior. A fighter; and she would never yield. Not to the scientists that 
had created this slagging program, she had seen to it that they never be 
given the opportunity to repeat the horrors unleashed upon her. And 
especially not to the program that plagued her so.*

"You forget," Tavatron choked through gritted teeth, "I may be a warrior, 
but I am not a transmetal such as yourself."

'Not anymore anyway.'

*Tavatron moved in the direction that he pushed her, slowly at first then 
gaining speed as she broke into a brisk, if somewhat unstable, walk. She 
limped/walked toward the tall doors of the now battle-weary CF; it had taken 
quite a beating. A pity really. The ship was grand, but no ship, no matter 
how great, could indefinitely survive the pummeling this one had taken. 
Tavatron fell against the doors, using her free hand to push one open while 
the other hand still clutched her side. She turned back to look at Dinobot, 
giving him something of a grin before disappearing inside the ship. 
Everything would be alright. Tavatron made her way to the CR chambers, 
dropping to the floor in the first available one. She closed her eyes as the 
chamber began to repair the worst of the damage. She peeled her hand away 
from her side. The dry fluid had imbedded itself in her fur. Amidst the mess 
of fur and fluid were a jumble of wires and exposed circuitry she had kept 
well hidden from Dinobot. She hadn't wanted him to worry. The wound was 
deep, and had effected some of her more vital systems, but the chamber would 
see to repairing those as well.*

<You like him, don't you?>

'Hmmph.'

*Tavatron closed her eyes, allowing the chamber to do its work. She didn't 
want to think about certain things right now. How she happened to be feeling 
toward a certain male was one of them. She wasn't even sure if that was how 
she felt. Tavatron growled in frustration. These things always confused her. 
It was something she couldn't control. She didn't like being in situations 
she couldn't control.*

'I remember the other song.'

<Do you now>

'Yes. A song by someone named Rymes, or something like that. 'Baby you're 
the right kind of wrong' was the chorus. I can't recall if that was the name 
as well.'

<Hmmph>
